tool.name: bcftools view
tool.description: Converts BCF format to VCF format
tool.command:
bcftools view #if str( $G ) == "true": -G #end if #if str( $g ) == "true": -g #end if #if str( $c ) == "true": -c #end if
#if str( $H ) == "only_header": -h #end if #if str( $H ) == "no_header": -H #end if
#if str( $G ) == "b": -b #end if #if str( $G ) == "u": -u #end if #if str( $G ) == "z": -z #end if #if str( $G ) == "v": -v #end if
#if $target_region_cond.target_region == "region": #if $target_region_cond.input_type_cond.input_type == "file": -R "$target_region_cond.input_type_cond.input_region_file" #else: -r "$target_region_cond.input_type_cond.input_region_text" #end if #end if #if $target_region_cond.target_region == "target": #if $target_region_cond.input_type_cond.input_type == "file": -T "$target_region_cond.input_type_cond.input_target_file" #else: -t "$target_region_cond.input_type_cond.input_target_text" #end if #end if
#if $samples_cond.samples_input == "file": -S "$samples_cond.input_samples_file" #end if #if $samples_cond.samples_input == "text": -s "$samples_cond.input_samples_text" #end if $input -o $output

param.label: Choose a bcf file to view
param.name: input

param.label: Include only sites with one or more homozygous (hom), heterozygous (het) or missing (miss) genotypes
param.name: g

param.label: Minimum allele count (INFO/AC) of sites to be printed
param.name: c

param.label: Print the header only or suppress the header in VCF output
param.name: H
param.option: Do not Print Header in VCF

param.help: Region requires indexed VCF/BCF files, while Target does not. Region is faster.
param.label: Use Target or Region option
param.name: target_region

param.label: Specify region by file or text input
param.name: input_type

param.help: The columns of the tab-delimited file are: CHROM, POS, and, optionally, POS_TO, where positions are 1-based and inclusive.
param.label: Region File
param.name: input_region_file

param.label: Specify targets by file or text input
param.name: input_type

param.help: The columns of the tab-delimited file are: CHROM, POS, and, optionally, POS_TO, where positions are 1-based and inclusive.
param.label: Target File
param.name: input_target_file

param.help: [^]chr|chr:pos|chr:from-to|chr:from-[,…]. Targets can be prefixed with '^' to request logical complement. For example, '^X,Y,MT' indicates that sequences X, Y and MT should be skipped.
param.label: Comma-separated list of targets
param.name: input_target_text

param.label: Trim alternate alleles not seen in subset.
param.name: A

param.label: Skip (re)calculate INFO fields for the subset
param.name: I

param.label: Specify samples to include or exclude
param.name: samples_input

param.help: File of sample names to include or exclude if prefixed with '^'. One sample per line.
param.label: Samples File
param.name: input_samples_file

param.label: Comma-separated list of samples to include or exclude if prefixed with '^'
param.name: input_samples_text

tool.help:
**What it does:**
This tool converts BCF files into VCF files using BCFtools view from the SAMtools set of utilities:
http://samtools.github.io/bcftools/bcftools.html#view
------
**Citation:**
For the underlying tool, please cite `Li H, Handsaker B, Wysoker A, Fennell T, Ruan J, Homer N, Marth G, Abecasis G, Durbin R; 1000 Genome Project Data Processing Subgroup. The Sequence Alignment/Map format and SAMtools. Bioinformatics. 2009 Aug 15;25(16):2078-9. <http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/19505943>`_
If you use this tool within Galaxy, please cite `Gregory Minevich, Danny S. Park, Daniel Blankenberg, Richard J. Poole, and Oliver Hobert. CloudMap: A Cloud-based Pipeline for Analysis of Mutant Genome Sequences. (Genetics 2012 In Press)`__
